titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for an event to commemorate the 10th Anniversary of the Million Man March.
Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for an event to commemorate the 10th Anniversary of the Million Man March.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Mr. Mica moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 161.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure
committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Permits the Million Man March, Inc. to sponsor a free public event on the Capitol grounds on October 15, 2005, to commemorate the 10th Anniversary of the Million Man March.
